extracted_text:
C.
Density Standards. The maximum number of dwelling units permissible in the R-D
Designed Residential District shall not exceed ninety percent (90%) of the number obtained by
dividing the gross acreage by the minimum Lot size permitted in the pre-existing zone, and
may be less where a determination is made by the Zoning Board that physical and
topographical features of the land would preclude attainment of such density under prior
existing zoning. (81-032; 203-04; 220-13)
llm_outputs.rationale: The section on Density Standards provides information on how to calculate the maximum number of dwelling units permissible, which is based on the minimum lot size permitted in the pre-existing zone. This implies that the minimum lot size is a known standard from the pre-existing zone, but the exact value is not provided in this document.
llm_outputs.answer: The minimum lot size is determined by the pre-existing zoning requirements and is used to calculate the maximum number of dwelling units permissible in the R-D Designed Residential District.
